marklogic.body: I'd love to try this so much as I didn't get an opportunity to buy some when I was in Paris recently, really gutted I missed out such a good opportunity! I really want a good, simple makeup remover that means no scrubbing, especially round my eyes! Recently I've been trying to simplify my skincare as my skin's been playing up, I like to use aqueous cream as a cleanser when massage it Off with a muslin cloth, it's moisturising but not greasy, really cheap and since doctors prescribe it I know it's not got any bad stuff in it. Even better, it can be used as a moisturiser on really Dry skin (although I try and avoid this as the fact that it's an emulsifier can wear away your skin over time -recent studies have shown-) If anyone's looking for a really cheap but very gentle cleanser, i really recommend going to your local chemist and picking a tub up :)
